alumni.title: Joelle Johnson
alumni.content: Former Retail Manager and CS Major
alumni.description: Having led in management for three years, Joelle's pivot to real estate led her to a fascination with data analytics. It was this intrigue that nudged her towards pursuing computer programming. Her forte lies in full stack development, particularly backend technologies, data manipulation, and security. An outgoing and team-driven individual, Joelle thrives on conquering new challenges. Outside of coding, Joelle is passionate about nature, family, and community outreach.
alumni.final_project_description: Don't know what to get your loved ones for that special occasion? Check out their wishlist on WishLily!

qa.title: Why Boca Code?
qa.answer: I chose Boca Code because I love coding. I felt that I was not learning at a satisfactory pace in college. I was able to code, but unable to engineer. I had no portfolio to showcase, and I wanted to be employable, quickly. I was hungry to learn how to make functioning full-stack apps, and Boca Code was a great way for me to hone my skills and become employable. I felt confident that Boca Code could fill in the gaps of information and leave me with a strong resume, portfolio, and network.

qa.title: What are some of the important skills for success in your field?
qa.answer: Knowing how to network, manage time, and problem solve.

qa.title: What inspired you to pursue your current career path?
qa.answer: A friend of mine was a young web developer, and he was financially independent and had a great work-life balance. I took the plunge, tried coding on my own at home, fell in love with it and pursued a degree in computer programming.

alumni.title: Andy Arias
alumni.description: I'm a 20-year-old Cuban, very enthusiastic and charismatic. I love learning new things and I'm passionate about programming. I have a keen interest in most technology fields. I'm known for being a very sociable and helpful person with many friends. I enjoy meeting new people and assisting others. I love working in a team and appreciate an organized work environment.
alumni.final_project_description: Sugar Smart is an app developed to help people with diabetes accurately store and track their blood-sugar levels.

alumni.title: John Savin
alumni.description: I am a servant leader to an amazing wife and 3 young boys who together have pushed me to evolve personally and professionally. Over the past 3 decades, I dedicated my career to working across three industries with play a major role in our lives - health, home and wealth. In 2022, my desire to pivot into tech grew seeing how influential it is in our lives. Being able to positively shape the way people use tech motivated me to take the plunge.

qa.answer: After 18 months deciding to pivot my career into tech, I decided to attend Boca Code because it provided a much needed structure and an in-depth, well-rounded curriculum. Being new to software engineering, I became overwhelmed navigating which skills to learn and programs to study. Boca Code focused my efforts with the tools and mentoring needed to break into this industry.

qa.title: What are some of the important skills for success in your field?
qa.answer: In wealth management, it is vital to be a highly communicative problem solver and figure of strength with your clients and team. Our solutions must be tailored to client needs and nimble to evolve as personal circumstances or market environments change.

qa.title: What inspired you to pursue your current career path?
qa.answer: Over my 30 plus year career I have chosen industries that have a direct impact on people - their health, home, and in 2001 personal finance. Upon seeing my parents struggle financially I dedicated the next two decades as a wealth manager so I can assist my family and others sharing similar challenges.

alumni.title: Micado Pierre
alumni.description: Born and raised in the vibrant Broward County, Florida, Micado embodies a unique blend of passions and expertise. A seasoned realtor with an eye for detail and a knack for understanding clients' needs, Micado has cultivated a reputation for integrity, dedication, and unparalleled service in the ever-evolving real estate landscape of South Florida. Beyond the world of property and negotiations, Micado leads a parallel life as a software engineer, navigating the intricate realm of coding, innovation, and technological advancements. With a penchant for problem-solving and a creative mind, Micado thrives in crafting elegant solutions to complex digital challenges. Even while excelling in the dynamic realms of real estate and technology, Micado has set their sights on a different horizon medicine. Currently pursuing a pre-medical education, Micado is fueled by a passion for understanding the human body and a desire to contribute to healthcare in meaningful ways. Juggling the worlds of business, technology, and medicine, Micado embraces the challenge with the same enthusiasm that defines their work ethic. In the moments between demanding schedules, you'll often find Micado on the basketball court, where the love for the game is nurtured. A dedicated player and a team enthusiast, basketball serves as a sanctuary, a place to unwind, strategize, and connect with others beyond the professional realms. With a multifaceted background and an unwavering commitment to growth and learning, Micado epitomizes the spirit of versatility and determination, showcasing the endless possibilities that arise from embracing diverse passions and pursuing multiple paths in life.
alumni.final_project_description: Never Miss A Stat: Introducing the Ultimate NBA Statistics App. Elevate your basketball fandom to a whole new level with the ZBSPORTS app your one-stop shop for all things NBA stats!

alumni.title: Yaslin Carmona
alumni.description: With a decade in financial sales, including two years in sales training, Yaslin transitioned to freelance front-end development. Driven by a thirst for knowledge and technology passion, she shifted towards full-stack engineering, enrolling in Boca Code. This shift blends her customer-centric background with technical expertise for impactful contributions to software engineering.
alumni.final_project_description: My project involves developing a comprehensive file manager and agenda organizer. This application aims to provide efficient file management capabilities along with an intuitive agenda system to help users stay organized and productive.

qa.title: Why Boca Code?
qa.answer: I chose Boca Code because of my initial positive experience with frontend development. I was drawn to the field and wanted to expand my knowledge to become a proficient full-stack engineer. Additionally, I saw it as a valuable opportunity to learn the latest technologies in the industry.

qa.title: What are some of the important skills for success in your field?
qa.answer: In my field, a combination of technical proficiency, effective communication, adaptability, and problem-solving skills are crucial for achieving success.

qa.title: What inspired you to pursue your current career path?
qa.answer: The inspiration behind my current career path stems from the quest for job security, a factor I found lacking in my previous profession. Additionally, witnessing the enduring passion that individuals have for their work, even after two decades, played a pivotal role in motivating me. The desire to create something impactful and meaningful further ignited my journey.

alumni.title: Jeniffer Giraldo
alumni.description: I am software engineer with a diverse background in teaching and education, skilled in critical thinking and problem-solving. Passionate about leveraging technology to enhance lives and make a positive impact. Lifelong learner eager to contribute to meaningful projects.
alumni.final_project_description: My project is dedicated to exploring the growing popularity of mocktails, the non-alcoholic alternatives to traditional cocktails. It delves into the reasons behind their rise, particularly focusing on health consciousness, the significance of designated drivers, inclusivity, and the creative potential they offer. By featuring a wide array of mocktail recipes and informative content, Sip Savvy Mocktails aims to encourage healthier lifestyle choices, promote overall public safety, and foster an inclusive environment for those opting to abstain from alcohol. The website celebrates the delightful and satisfying nature of mocktails, highlighting their complexity and visual appeal. Through this project, I aim to contribute to a responsible and enjoyable social drinking culture, where mocktails play a positive and exciting role.

qa.title: Why Boca Code?
qa.answer: The small class sizes and project-based learning approach appealed to me, as it allows for personalized attention and practical skills development. Additionally, the positive reviews and success stories from alumni motivated me to overcome my initial intimidation and pursue my interest in coding.

qa.title: What are some of the important skills for success in your field?
qa.answer: The most important skill for success in the tech industry as a software engineer is adaptability. It will allow me to connect my teaching expertise with the technical skills required in software engineering. Embracing adaptability will help me thrive in this field and making a successful transition into the tech industry.

qa.title: What inspired you to pursue your current career path?
qa.answer: The pursuit of a career in the tech field is driven by the need for financial stability and a passion for utilizing technology to benefit teachers, students, and parents. As an educator, I am constantly formulating creative ideas, but unfortunately, my current profession lacks the support to bring them to fruition. Transitioning into the tech industry presents an exciting opportunity to explore and implement my ideas freely, fostering ingenuity and empowering creativity. I am eager to blend my existing skills with technology, making a significant impact on education while also enjoying improved financial prospects and personal growth in this ever-changing field.

It was this inspiration that led me to pursue a career path in tech, and I am so glad I did.

alumni.title: Daniel Barba
alumni.description: For Daniel, as a former machinist and product developer, building and design is both a trade and hobby. He loves to optimize and create new systems and solutions for clients of all types. A leader and entrepreneur at heart, but engineer in practice, he loves challenges and making ideas a reality.
alumni.final_project_description: PigEBank is a banking and chore tracking app built to equip parents to teach their kids about finances. Using chores as income, parents can teach their children fundamentals in managing income, savings, and debt.

qa.title: Why Boca Code?
qa.answer: I actually saw a Facebook ad for Boca Code as a 10 week bootcamp, which is very fast. When I went to visit the school, after meeting Todd and seeing how genuinely happy and interested the students were, I could tell this course and the instructors are not there to waste your time (Todd actually said the second part lol). This is a complete take back from my college experience where everything was far slower, more time and money investing, with far less return.

qa.title: What are some of the important skills for success in your field?
qa.answer: I would say adaptability, flexibility, and applicability. Our world changes so fast, being stuck on one system, one way, one tool, etc... certainly, with few exceptions, is going to leave an individual behind. These three are best summarized in the ability to know how to learn. We have a lot of internet tools at our disposal that aids in that, and being an actual pre requisite course at Boca Code before joining the cohort and applying this during the course certainly has proven helpful to all of us at BC.

qa.title: What inspired you to pursue your current career path?
qa.answer: Of all the engineering disciplines I have touched the last 10 years, this has always stuck out the most as my favorite. As a kid I played a lot with electronics and recently, before Boca Code, a lot of work with the Arduino framework and ATmel chips. Software development and engineering brings to life mechatronic or completely electronic based platforms and systems, and is certainly the future on the horizon.

alumni.title: Anthony Murphy
alumni.description: Coming fresh from High School, Anthony is ready to dive head-first into programming. Before programming with Boca Code, he has had some previous experience in Python. Anthony is one-of-a-kind with a unique style and a passion for design.
alumni.final_project_description: For those who need to get their opinions on music out there as quick and simply as possible, Chromesthesia is a website made to effortlessly post thoughts on music.

qa.title: Why Boca Code?
qa.answer: The reason why I chose Boca Code was because I wanted an in-person bootcamp that would be affordable and would take only a relatively short time-span compared to taking a college course. I also wanted a more personal experience with a small but tight-knit class.

qa.title: What are some of the important skills for success in your field?
qa.answer: Some of the most important skills to have while working within the coding field are communication, being open to always learning, being open to criticism, and to be able to break big problems down to small parts.

qa.title: What inspired you to pursue your current career path?
qa.answer: As a child I had a love for technology and was fascinated by computers and games. In high school I had taken a Python class and something seemed to click for me that hasn’t in any other career field.

alumni.title: Beatriz Recari
alumni.description: Former professional winner on the LPGA Tour now pursuing a career in the tech industry. Beatriz is passionate about everything she does and always commits 100%. Discipline and hard work are engrained in her. She is also a talented painter and pianist.
alumni.final_project_description: Pracpal is an app designed for athletes by athletes, with user/password and Google sign in where they can log their practice regime for the week, update it and delete it. They are able also to retrieve stored data optimizing efficiency.

qa.title: Why Boca Code?
qa.answer: As soon as I entered the school and saw the atmosphere I immediately knew that was my place.

qa.title: What are some of the important skills for success in your field?
qa.answer: To stay up to date with the latest technologies in order to advice to the best of my capabilities to my employers.

qa.title: What inspired you to pursue your current career path?
qa.answer: I have always been a nerd at heart so I went all in and couldn’t be happier with my choice. Tech is the future!

alumni.title: Andy Linnell
alumni.description: Andy is an experienced professional with a background in IT and asset management. He has a natural talent for problem-solving and has always had a keen interest in technology. He is a valuable team player with a strong commitment to making a positive impact on the future, and is well-equipped to tackle complex challenges and deliver results.
alumni.final_project_description: Zen Path is a gamified beginners guide to meditation. It was created to help anyone learn how to meditate properly and quickly feel the benefits of a quite mind.

qa.title: Why Boca Code?
qa.answer: I chose Boca Code because I wanted to turn my life around and explore new career opportunities that would offer long-term growth and higher pay. Additionally, I felt uncertain about the long-term prospects of my current industry and saw Boca Code as a chance to seek new challenges and personal growth.

qa.title: What are some of the important skills for success in your field?
qa.answer: Some of the most important skills for success include strong problem-solving abilities, effective communication skills, and the ability to work collaboratively as part of a team. Additionally, staying up-to-date with industry trends and technologies, being adaptable and willing to learn, and having a passion for innovation and creativity.

qa.title: What inspired you to pursue your current career path?
qa.answer: I have always had a personal interest or passion for coding as well as a desire to make a positive impact on society or to help others. An added bonus is the financial stability and job security the industry provides.

alumni.title: Joseph Graffeo
alumni.description: Joe was born and raised in Boca Raton. He graduated Summa Cum Laude from Lynn University in 2019, where he played baseball and earned a Bachelor's Degree in Sports Management. Joe is passionate about UX/UI design and aspires to work in game development one day.
alumni.final_project_description: Aimed at providing gamers with a seamless and streamlined experience to effortlessly track their gaming activities in one unified place, CertifiedGamer is a simple and easy to use app that bridges the gap between dozens of gaming platforms and providers.

qa.title: Why Boca Code?
qa.answer: I chose Boca Code because it offered an in-person learning experience, which I valued highly if I was going to take a chance and change careers. I also read nothing but glowing reviews about the staff and the process, which I am able to corroborate now having gone through it myself. I am incredibly happy that I made the decision to come to Boca Code in the end.

qa.title: What are some of the important skills for success in your field?
qa.answer: Attention to detail and planning in advance stand out to me. Planning out your project before executing the actual code makes an unbelievable difference in efficiency and helps keep you on track to reach the goal. Attention to detail is another important skill, as someone who enjoys front-end development I have learned that focus (or lack thereof) on even the smallest details can make or break a project.

qa.title: What inspired you to pursue your current career path?
qa.answer: I have always loved computers as an extension of my love for gaming. In time I grew to love all things tech and even tried to teach myself to code as a child. I thought it was over my head for the longest time, decided to forgo the opportunity to learn again in college and eventually ended up feeling stagnant after a few years at my former company. After finding Boca Code and realizing that I had a tangible opportunity to make software engineering my career, I finally decided to take the chance I didn’t take when I was younger. I could not be more thrilled with my decision.

alumni.title: Gisele Abzalov
alumni.description: Gisele has a creative perspective on the tech industry. She is dedicated to making a positive impact and leveraging her expertise to help any organization achieve their goals. She is constantly seeking opportunities to grow and improve her skills.
alumni.final_project_description: Cheers!, furnishes beverage recipes tailored for various occasions using uncomplicated ingredients and straightforward instructions.

qa.title: Why Boca Code?
qa.answer: When I was searching for software programming classes, I wanted to find something local with an extensive curriculum taught by a teacher. I was happy to find a school in Boca that provides that and more. I already had a degree and didn't want to spend a lot of money, but most importantly, time to change my career path. Also, I didn't know exactly which programming applications I wanted to learn. I was glad that Boca Code provides education for the most currently used languages and goes above and beyond to ensure that students comprehend the material. It was hard, I'm not going to lie, but it was surely well worth it, and hard work will pay off.

qa.title: What are some of the important skills for success in your field?
qa.answer: I will answer that question with something that I lack and am trying to work on. It is perseverance and patience. It takes some time to learn a new skill regardless of age and life experience.

qa.title: What inspired you to pursue your current career path?
qa.answer: I love learning new things. I knew it wouldn't be easy to learn software engineering, but I wanted to challenge myself. We live in the era of technology, and it is a useful and necessary skill to learn. I hope to use it in my businesses, and who knows, maybe I will have a startup in the future. It is important for entrepreneurs to evolve by incorporating new tech in their businesses.

alumni.title: Anttoinette Henry
alumni.description: Anttoinette has been looking to merge beauty and tech into one. A passionate and successful entrepreneur, she is motivated, dedicated, works well on teams and loves everything outdoors!
alumni.final_project_description: Black women often struggle to be recognized for their beauty in society. Our skin tone, hair texture, and history of revolution have resulted in a negative stigma, making us feel unwanted and undesirable. As a result, many of us avoid standing out and embracing our uniqueness. However, Ireccostyle is here to remind black women that they are seen, heard, and appreciated for their beauty.

alumni.title: Gianna Davila
alumni.description: Gianna is one of our youngest graduates ever. What she lacks in experience, she makes up for in persistence, hard work, and brilliance. She isn't one to back down from a challenge.

alumni.title: Edgar Davila
alumni.description: Edgar is no stranger to tech, he started fixing his first iPhone when he was only 10, resolving software issues and doing repairs, even Jalibreaking them. Now he's pursuing Software Engenireering in combination with Cybersecurity.

alumni.title: Mido Khalil
alumni.description: Mido has lived in and traveled to many countries. This, and his background in Hospitality help him get along with everyone. He was a top insurance agent at a large brokerage. Now he is a fantastic Engineer that can be a powerful addition to any team.

alumni.title: Gerly Kaytukov
alumni.description: Gerly has been a realtor for 20 years, including being a broker agent for the past 5 years. She also has experience in Marketing and studied MIS at FAU. She is a great team player.

alumni.title: Eddie Espinosa
alumni.description: Eddie has a strong background in Marketing, but has become increasingly interested in Software Engineering and has studied it intensely for the past 2 1/2 years. He is a powerhouse Engineer and an incredible mentor to more Junior Engineers.

alumni.title: Adi Fischer
alumni.description: Adi formerly served as a Drill Sergeant in the Israeli Army. She later moved to Brooklyn and worked as a Sound Engineer and a Teacher. She is a natural leader and unafraid to work hard.

alumni.title: Ainis Taranda
alumni.description: Ainis was born in Lithuania and moved to the US when he was young. He studied Exercise Physiology at FAU. He loved doing research, but Covid limited his ability to work in the lab. This lead him to learn coding. His scientific background serves him well as an Engineer.

alumni.title: Corwin Hiatt
alumni.description: Corwin grew up in rural Oregon. He's passionate about tech, math, finance, crypto, and disc golf. He's worked as a Construction Foreman and Project Manager. He first got interested in coding when customizing his MySpace page.

alumni.title: Emily LaBelle
alumni.description: Emily began her tech career studying CS at PBSC, but wanted more. She's also been a manager at several large retail stores. Her technical chops will be a big asset to any team.

alumni.title: Tyler Jefferson
alumni.description: Tyler has worked in Sales and more recently as an Account Manager and Executive, primarily in leasing for apartment complexes. He’s been around computers his whole life and has built his own PCs. Tyler is a great team player with impressive technical skills.
